main event: A woman observed a reddish-orange object that appeared to float and bob over a relatively small area for about 5-6 minutes in Roann, Indiana on June 8, 1966.
interesting points: The object had a diameter of about 30 feet and moved in an erratic pattern within a very small area.
The observer reported that the object appeared to move towards the southeast at a very high rate of speed and seemed to accelerate.
The observer stated that there had been at least six similar sightings within a 5-mile radius of the current sighting in the past year, but they were not reported due to fear of adverse publicity.
An HH43B helicopter was launched to investigate the sighting, but the pilot reported not observing the UFO.
The Air Force concluded that the sighting was likely caused by a B-58 aircraft using its afterburner just prior to landing at Bunker Hill Air Force Base.
sighted object: a reddish-orange object that appeared to float and bob
